Row.Text: Salutations! You stand in the presence of the Emperor Taizong. Men call me the Son of Heaven; it's something of a meaningless title, but I like it nonetheless.
Pig! You will never be able to replicate that which you have destroyed.
You must be some sort of fool... any learned man can see that you stand no chance against me.
I am willing to make enemies, but I am also willing to forge alliances. What do you say to a public Declaration of Friendship?

With good men as a mirror, a man can see whether he is right or wrong. It is clear, however, that you have no such men.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
All barbarians must be subdued. For your own good, I advise you not to resist.
A superstitious man would tell you that your expansion would anger Heaven; I think it's sufficient to warn you that it's angering me.
Begone with you! There's a war on, you know, and I won't have you eavesdropping on my chancellors.
It is always valuable to hear from a trusted friend. What have you come to speak to me about?
Right then, let's do business.
Well, this is an unpleasant sight. Let's get this over with.
I have showed admirable restraint about your military posturing thus far, but my patience will only carry me so far. I advise you not to test it further.
So, show me what goods they produce in your lands! I will take only the finest.
If Wei Zheng were still alive, he would never have let me make such mistakes...
You bring with you intriguing wares. What might I do to persuade you to part with them?
I killed my own brothers for this position. You think I'll be more merciful toward you?
My people long to travel all the world over; I hope you will be gracious enough to grant them that freedom.
Don't insult me.
A righteous emperor can acknowledge when he needs help, and now is one of those times.
Well, it's clear that you understand nothing about governance. At least I know I can disregard your words going forward.
Wars do not end as easily as you presume. My work is not yet done.
Well, that's done with. Do not grieve too much - your lands will be wealthy and pacified under my rulership.
Our people have traded for so long, and yet it's only now I meet you! They tell me you are wise, even for a man of superstition.
So this is what you think of our alliance! Enjoy your victory while it lasts, scoundrel.
...This is because I wouldn't let you marry my daughter, isn't it.
